page.title: 12Sheltered Housing in Chobham
page.content: Mrs Wright has been{warden}for 3 years. She carries a bleeper around. If there is an{emergency}it will bleep. There is a wooden thing with the numbers of the rooms on. If a{lady goes out she would put the out sign on. In the kitchen was a gas cooker. The{residents}were not allowed to use {gas cookers}but the kitchen had one just in case they could not use {electricity.}There was a bath and a shower in the{bathroom.}We visited the longest staying resident. Her room was very tidy. There was a tiny{kitchen with a tiny half cooker. She had her own{televison}and bathroom. She was 83 and had lived there 18 years. She cleans her own{flat}and has a{garden. Upstairs is a spare room for visitors. There is a{standing lift}to go upstairs. There is a trolley{library. The housing service was open in 1967.
